title: Drawing, "Design for a Decorative Ewer", 1765
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, black chalk on white laid paper
markings: Verso, Cooper Union Museum, New York, stamp 457e
inscribed: Pen and brown ink, lower left: J. C. Delafosse
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Handle of ewer consists of swan kissing harpy who is encircled by a crouching female satyr. The body is decorated in neoclassical style, fluting, rope-like festoons, a female mask, suspended fruit garlands, coiled snake forms base.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for a Decorative Ewer", 1765. Pen and black ink, brush and wash, black chalk on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-385.
